qas.question: In what year did Blackpool and Blackburn become independent unitary authorities?
In what year was Simonswood transferred from Knowsley to West Lancashire
Which places were added to the new county of Cheshire?
Where were the boroughs of Liverpool, Knowsley, St Helens and Sefton included?
Which parish was transferred from Knowsley to the district of West Lancashire?
Besides Greater Manchester, to what other county was a part of Oldham incorporated into?
In what year was Liverpool made a part of Merseyside?
In what year was Skipton Rural District made part of Lancashire?
In addition to Greater Manchester, part of Tameside became a portion of what other county?
When was Sefton included as part of Merseyside?

context: The boroughs of Liverpool, Knowsley, St Helens and Sefton were included in <a3_0><b8_0>Merseyside<b8_0/><a3_0/>. In Greater Manchester the successor boroughs were Bury, Bolton, Manchester, Oldham (part), Rochdale, Salford, Tameside (part), Trafford (part) and Wigan. <a2_0>Warrington and Widnes<a2_0/>, south of the new Merseyside/Greater Manchester border were added to the new non-metropolitan county of Cheshire. The urban districts of Barnoldswick and Earby, Bowland Rural District and the parishes of Bracewell and Brogden and Salterforth from Skipton Rural District in the West Riding of Yorkshire became part of the new <b5_0>Lancashire<b5_0/>. One parish, <a4_0>Simonswood<a4_0/>, was transferred from the borough of Knowsley in Merseyside to the district of West Lancashire in <a1_0><b7_0>1994<b7_0/><a1_0/>. In <a0_0><b6_0><b9_0>1998<b9_0/><b6_0/><a0_0/> Blackpool and Blackburn with Darwen became independent unitary authorities.
